intro: Erigeron maxonii, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its showy white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Erigeron maxonii has narrow, grayish-green leaves and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It is a perennial plant that is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun.
